name: places/ChIJ72MeZLxYwokRLXu7qJnmohE

displayName.text: Glenn Reit DDS - Upper East Side Dentist

authorAttributions.displayName: Glenn Reit DDS - Upper East Side Dentist

adrFormatAddress: 1498 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10028, USA

originalText.text:
Dr Glenn REiT greeted me with a warm welcoming personality. This was my first visit since my long-time dentist retired. I wanted a professional on the UpperEastside.
I experienced a wonderful first impression that “exceeded my expectations”.
Dr REiT spent time to relationship build with me. He took x-rays and showed them to me: explaining my “current mouth condition”: asking me for feedback as we agreed to
- next steps to manage my teeth, gums, existing dental work. He was upbeat, positive in his assessment.
I would refer anyone
- to make an appointment
- to experience a seasoned experienced professional
- I will definitely return.
PS: I loved my swag packet with “maintenance goodies”
AND
A personalized newsletter personally written by Dr Glenn!!
And his prices are quite reasonable!
Bonnie Manter,UpperEastside

originalText.text: I liked that the dentist is experienced and his hygenist is the best. But you go to seek medical care to feel better not worse and the Dr. stressed me out with his catastophizing everytime I visited the clinic to get me to change my plan without having a clue about my financial situation. For every visit, I would need to mentally prepare myself to hear a probability (a worst case scenario) repeated several times as if it's a certainty. For services that were not covered by the insurance, the dentist would mention a number then at checkout that number suddenly increases by hundreds of dollars. How? I don't know. When I ask for an explanation he starts showing too many numbers with his calculator till you get confused and overwhelmed. Only God knows how many times this clinic  overcharged their patients unfairly. Gave him the benefit of the doubt and remained a customer for several years but everytime I went for a specific thing he would ask for x-rays without explaining the medical necessity for it nor the financial cosequences, like just saying "tell me Im not crazy let me check this tooth at the back"!!! Then when dental work was needed the insurance money was already spent on what was unnecessary. If you're blinded by greed how can you see the negative consequences of your actions on others? Or admit your mistakes and take responsibility for them?? We are humans, we make mistakes this is normal, but the lack of accountability with a loyal patient really shows that this is just another transactional business where patient care is not #1 priority.

originalText.text:
Dr. Glenn Reit is the best dentist in Manhattan. Mark my words. Here's my story:
I graduated college in 2016 and moved to the Upper East Side with a dream as a newly minted college grad: take on the city and make my mark.
After a few months I realized I needed a dentist. I started asking around and heard horror stories - from dentists drilling holes in your teeth to unskilled NYU dental grads with no experience.
I checked the providers who accepted my insurance and saw Dr. Reit's name on the list. That's the first positive - Dr. Reit DOES accept insurance.
When I went to my first appointment, the secretary greeted me with a water bottle (always nice) and offered to hang up my jacket and briefcase. That day, the dental hygienists had left for the day, so Dr. Reit himself did the cleaning (wow). He's straight and to the point, no BS and very personable and funny. What more could you want?
I was so pleased with my experience that I spread the word at my office. A few of my colleagues went to Dr. Reit, and again to my surprise, I received AMC movie tickets in the mail a few weeks later as a thank you for the referrals. The next time I went in for a cleaning, Dr. goes "the gifts get better." Occasionally, I'll receive a newsletter in the mail, written by Dr. Reit himself with an update on his practice (if there's any exciting news) and some neat dental hygiene tricks. How cool is that?!
All in all, I couldn't be more pleased with Dr. Reit's practice. The entire staff is sweet and kind, and the hygienists are so competent it's easy to confuse them for licensed dentists. I've since moved out of state but refuse to find a new dentist - what's the point?
Thanks, Dr. Reit.

originalText.text:
A big reason I kept with my current job was to enroll in their company healthcare, and I am very grateful I did.

Dr. Reit had me feeling like Chip Skylark after my appointment. Incredibly knowledgeable and easy to communicate with. He was very informative, and the gift basket of dental products was a wonderful sendoff- it even included an eccentric, entertaining news letter. As other's mentioned, very clean office as well.

originalText.text: Came here on the recommendation of a co-worker after 2 dentists where I live in NJ failed to diagnose my painful tooth and I’m so glad I did. Dr Reit stayed past his closing hours to help me and had me come back the next morning ( from NJ) so he could work on my tooth more. He also called to see how I was ( do Dr’s still do that?), and as you can imagine, I simply cannot recommend him highly enough. I seldom write reviews, but this level of skill and  kindness deserves one. He certainly made a difference in my life.
